DOC.brief_summary: This study is a comparison of postoperative pain in children with cerebral palsy after surgery on the hip or femur. One group is treated with p.o. (by mouth) or intravenous (i.v.) analgesia, and the other group is treated with local infiltration analgesia with Naropine. Pain is measured with r-FLACC, a pain-score validated for children with cerebral palsy.
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Pain in Children With Cerebral Palsy After Pelvic and Femoral Osteotomies
DOC.criteria: Age under 18 informed consent Postoperative cast with spica Previous surgery in the same hip Other surgical procedure planned at the same time Bilateral surgery Previous allergic reaction to local analgesia
